name: Trouva
slogan: Online destination for unique products from the world's best independent boutiques
description:
Trouva’s mission is to unite the UK’s best independent boutiques with the millions of people across the world who are looking for their next unique find. There are thousands of small independent boutiques with beautiful product selections spread out across the physical world, but discovering and purchasing these products can be notoriously difficult for consumers. 

At Trouva we provide these independent boutiques with the technology required to thrive online, as well as connecting them with a community of people who desire beautiful products. As TechCrunch put it, we allow store owners focus on what they do best: having beautiful offline experiences and selecting the right products for their customer base.

jobs.title: Brand Marketing Intern
jobs.description:
Trouva is one of the fastest growing tech businesses in Europe (TNW Tech5), one of Wired Magazine's hottest European Startups and debuted at no.3 in the prestigious Startups 100 Index, ranking the UK’s best high growth startups.

A software-enabled marketplace, Trouva brings customers beautiful homewares from the best independent boutiques around the world. We know that unless people happen to be in the right place, at the right time, that perfect piece can be impossible to find. All too often, it’s sitting in a shop somewhere they don’t even know about yet. That’s where we come in. Trouva was founded to make it easy for customers to discover just the right thing for them... wherever in the world it may be hiding.

We’re lucky enough to be backed by world leading investors whose successes include ASOS, Farfetch, and Dropbox (Index Ventures, Octopus Venture and BGF), with Angel Investors including current and former C level execs from Just Eat, Google, eBay & Deliveroo. We’ve been covered by the likes of Forbes, Vogue, The BBC, TechCrunch and Sky News and have won Emerging Retailer of the Year at the Retail Week Awards, as well as being recognised by the likes of Retail 100, Maserati 100 and Technation’s Future Fifty.

What's the role?

We're looking for a bright and driven intern to join Trouva’s Brand Marketing team. The ideal candidate is passionate about interiors, independent brands and boutiques. You’ll have a list of consumer brands you love and follow (on social and via email newsletters) with a good understanding of why they are brilliant at what they do. We are looking for a highly organised team player, who has exceptional written skills and wants to work in a fast-growing ecommerce environment.

What you’ll do:

* Weekly Instagram planning plus daily community management
* Curate seasonal edits of trending products to support weekly email content
* Support the Brand Marketing team with day-to-day tasks like press image requests and loans

Requirements

Who you are:

* You will need to have a strong degree (2:1 or above)
* Flawless writing style and attention to detail
* Exceptional organisational skills and a naturally structured approach to your thinking. You’ll be ready to take a hands-on approach and hit the ground running!
* A great eye, you’ll love moodboarding and follow plenty of influential Instagram accounts
* Knowledge of interior, fashion and culture trends
* A passion for Trouva and what we stand for

Benefits

What you'll get in return

* Competitive salary in one of the UK’s most exciting startups.
* 33 days including 8 bank holidays per annum (pro -rated)
* A beautiful office space in Central London, with unlimited coffee, snacks and fresh fruit
* Need tech or equipment? We'll provide you with what you need to get the job done
* Regular team events where we celebrate our success and people, including weekly meditation, yoga, five a side football and Pizza Friday's!
* Company benefits membership (e.g. discount on Apple products, discounted gym membership, free mobile phone insurance - via Perkbox)
* Unlimited staff discount on all Trouva products

jobs.title: Customer Service Advisor
jobs.description:
Trouva is one of the fastest growing tech businesses in Europe (TNW Tech5 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fthenextweb.com%2Fbusiness%2F2019%2F02%2F21%2Fhere-are-the-5-hottest-startups-in-the-uk%2F) ), one of Wired (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.co.uk%2Farticle%2Fbest-startups-in-london-2018) Magazine's hottest European Startups and is 3rd in the prestigious Startups 100 Index (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fstartups.co.uk%2Fstartups-100%2F2019%2Fstartups-100-2019%2F) , ranking the UK’s best high growth startups.

A software-enabled marketplace, Trouva brings customers beautiful homewares from the best independent boutiques around the world. We’re building a different kind of e-commerce experience, driven by discovery and inspiration. Using cutting edge technology, Trouva harnesses the expertise of the best bricks-and-mortar shops from Shoreditch to Stockholm, and scales their offering online to connect with a global customer base seeking unique, hard-to-find homewares.

Backed by world-leading investors, we’re growing incredibly quickly and are looking for exceptional people to join the Trouva family. Get a feel for what we're about through our Instagram (https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fwearetrouva) or vision page (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.trouva.com%2Fpages%2Fourvision) !

As part of our rapid growth, we now have offices in London and Lisbon, and an ever expanding community of boutiques across Europe. As a result, we’re constantly on the hunt to find exceptional talent, who share our vision and are fiercely passionate about what they do. Based in our offices in central Lisbon, a Customer Service Advisor will be the first port of call for Trouva customers and our community of boutiques; who wants to deliver the highest level of customer service at all times.

What you'll do:

* Manage with customer queries to ensure that they are responded to in a timely fashion delivering an outstanding service at every touch point
* Provide information with regards to products/services and other related inquiries;
* Work to targets and resolve customer issues and complaints across multiple channels. You will be communicating through well-crafted and personal emails, warm chatty telephone calls and rapid-fire live chat responses
* Identify, report on and troubleshoot potential issues and pain-points in our operations, as well as proactively proposing improvements
* Be the face of Trouva to our customers and partners alike

Requirements

Who you are:

* Experienced in customer service (minimum of 1 year)
* Flexibility in schedule is essential; must be available to work weekends and bank holidays.
* Fluent in English and at least one of the following - German, French, Italian or Spanish (mandatory);
* Proficient in the use of IT systems, both customer service specific and windows/Google Suite packages Zendesk experience beneficial;
* Comfortable working in a target driven environment.
* A genuine passion for providing outstanding customer service, and motivation to go above and beyond to delight our customers and boutiques.
* A natural, friendly phone manner and sound written communication skills.
* Determined to own a customer’s problem, and follow up until resolved.
* Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and ability to multitask.
* Sound Excel skills, being able to liaise with a technical team effectively to solve problems.
* Hard working and passionate

Benefits

What you'll get in return

* Competitive salary
* 25 days holiday plus any applicable bank holidays
* A central co-working space to base yourself from
* Need tech or equipment? we'll provide you with everything you need to get the job done
* Regular team events where we celebrate our success and people
* Unlimited staff discount on all Trouva products and a Trouva gift card to get something awesome for your desk.

* Experience setting up and exploring tools to make it easy for engineers to collaborate on developing solutions, sharing their ideas, testing and getting things into production.

jobs.description:
We are growing our boutique community across Europe and are looking for Local Shop Hunters to help us find the very best boutiques in these cities. * Their own mobile phone with Google Maps (and ideally an external battery charger!)

* The opportunity to explore your local city visiting some of the very best independent shops
* 100EUR + travel expenses per day

jobs.title: Operations Executive
jobs.description:
Trouva is the world’s leading marketplace for independent boutiques. We provide an online platform for beautiful bricks-and-mortar stores to sell their home-wares, clothing, and accessories internationally. We’re an award-winning platform, backed by VC and Angel Investors whose successes include Secret Escapes, Net-A-Porter, and Farfetch and have been widely recognised for our logistics and tech innovation. Moreover, we’re a passionate team, with the vision to create a thriving global community of independent shops and shoppers united by their passion for unique products.

To ensure that we're providing our Customers and Boutiques with the best possible experience, we're on the hunt for an Operations Executive to join the team. Based in our offices in Central London, you'll be the first port of call for Trouva customers and our community of boutiques; acting as a passionate problem solver, who wants to deliver the highest level of customer service at all times. You'll benefit from a tight knit team and structured training and insight program through the Trouva Academy.

What you'll do:

* Liaise with our boutiques to make sure orders run smoothly, anticipating and troubleshooting potential issues and finding solutions for any problems that arise.
* Work to targets and resolve customer issues and complaints across multiple channels. You will be communicating through well-crafted and personal emails, warm chatty telephone calls and rapid-fire live chat responses.
* Partner closely with our Community team, to educate and empower our boutiques to make the most of the Trouva community.
* Identify, report on and troubleshoot potential issues and pain-points in our operations, as well as proactively proposing improvements.
* You'll be enrolled into a 1 year training program which will provide you with the opportunity for cross-functional operations exposure and insight into one of the fastest growing start ups in Europe.

Requirements

Who you are:

* Flexibility in schedule is essential; must be available to work some weekends and bank holidays.
* Comfortable working in a target driven environment.
* A genuine passion for providing outstanding customer service, and motivation to go above and beyond to delight our customers and boutiques.
* A natural, friendly phone manner and sound written communication skills.
* Determined to own a customer’s problem, and follow up until resolved.
* Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and ability to multitask.
* A desire to seek solutions to improve our operations, user interface and service procedures.
* Sound excel skills, being able to liaise with a technical team effectively to solve problems.

Benefits

What you'll get in return:

* Competitive salary and share options in one of the UK’s most exciting startups. Equity is very important to us - we want you to be a shareholder in the company so you are part of the upside if we're successful together
* 33 days including 8 bank holidays per annum
* Generous parental leave offering
* Company pension
* A beautiful office space in Central London, with unlimited coffee, snacks and fresh fruit
* Need tech or equipment? We'll provide whatever you need to get the job done
* Regular team events where we celebrate our success and people
* Company benefits membership (e.g. discount on Apple products, discounted gym membership, free mobile phone insurance - via Perkbox)
* Unlimited staff discount on all Trouva products and a Trouva gift card to get something awesome for your desk.

Sounds like a Tribe you want to be a part of? Click the apply button and send us your CV and Cover Letter, detailing why you'd be a great fit for Trouva and your special talent that you'd bring to the team.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.description:
BRIEF

As Product Designer you will work with our team, our boutique community and our customers to create beautiful online experiences. The challenge is diverse: you’ll have the opportunity to work on inventory management, order processing, internal communication tools, but also, and maybe most importantly, on creating an alternative shopping experience for the Trouva customer.

OUR VALUES

We believe in communicating effectively, thoroughly, empathetically and openly. We involve other people in what we’re doing early on to ensure we’re moving in the right direction and get feedback on our plans.

We want to be supported by the whole team, but ultimately be empowered to drive solutions as individuals. To gain this level of trust, we need to be confident that we gather the right requirements, we test to prove what we’ve built works and we test to ensure the result is robust. Furthermore, we document because we respect our future selves and team members.

We are open and transparent in the way we work. We expose our ideas and solutions early and follow the mantra that good is better than perfect. We invite others to challenge our ideas and help us achieve the best we can. This allows us be confident we deliver what is expected in the timeline we have proposed.

We’re one of the fastest growing companies in the world and we have wild ambitions. We thrive by delivering quality, impactful products at a fast pace, while improving how we work as a team. 

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

You have a strong portfolio demonstrating a variety of work on web & mobile projects. Show us your understanding of interaction design, UX & UI principles and demonstrate how you have solved problems in the past.

You view the design process as a learning experience and you’re eager to dig deeper; understanding the root cause is your objective. You feel empowered to understand, question and iterate over what currently exists.
 
You’re able to jump straight into code if needed, HTML/CSS maybe even a bit of Javascript. Sometimes it’s just easier to prove a concept by code, other times you’re comfortable with prototyping or visualising your thoughts in Sketch (or similar software). 

You’ve worked in a team with other engineers before and understand the basic principles of Git.

You’ve at least tinkered around with JQuery and/or some popular front-end frameworks out there (Ember.js, React or Angular). You understand that a Javascript is an enabler that frees up your creativity and you’re either interested in learning more or have already got proven experience utilising it.

Our technology platform enables small business owners handle everything from inventory management to customer support & logistics. We provide customers with access to inventory that was not available before and create a seamless shopping experience when buying from independent boutiques.

As a Senior Frontend Engineer you’ll be responsible for the client-facing website, while working closely with the rest of the team to progress Trouva’s technology platform. The challenge is diverse: you’ll have the opportunity to work on inventory management, order processing, internal communication tools, but also, and maybe most importantly, on creating an alternative shopping experience for the Trouva customer.

We are a full-stack Javascript team utilising a one-language for all approach that allows us to work together efficiently and provide great experiences. It also means that we get to play with shiny new things often which we’re quite happy about. In the end though, we are product engineers and are driven by providing the best possible experience to our customers.

* You have previously developed multiple high-scale production applications using the React framework. Through this you’ve gained a deep understanding of the evolution of Javascript, at least up to ES6. You’re up-to-date with modern browser capabilities from service workers to HTML components.

* You embrace HTML & SASS and are keen to continuously learn & follow best practices (eg, by using Block Element Modifier), setting an example for the team. Your knowledge ranges from understanding the semantics behind different HTML tags to browser compatibility standards.

* You have a keen interest in working with designers to build beautiful experiences for the end-user.

* Whilst you’ve spent most of your time on the browser, you’re comfortable with writing a simple Node application, something like a basic API powered by Express. At minimum you should be able to represent client side API needs

* Competitive Maternity, Paternity and Adoption leave policies
* A beautiful office space in Central London, with unlimited coffee, snacks and fresh fruit
* Macbook Pro and Bose Noise cancelling headphones as standard issue, and any other tech you need to get the job done
* Regular team events where we celebrate our success and people, including weekly meditation, yoga, five a side football and Pizza Friday's!
* Company benefits membership (e.g. discount on Apple products, discounted gym membership, free mobile phone insurance - via Perkbox)

THE OPPORTUNITY

As Senior Product Designer on the Retail Operations squad, you will lead design for our boutique platform and help our community of boutiques deliver the best experience for Trouva customers. You’ll have the opportunity to redefine how boutiques manage inventory, process their orders, ship their products to customers, and so much more.

In this role, you’ll:

* Collaborate with others. You partner with the Product Manager to be the voice of the boutiques and work with Engineers to build meaningful experiences.
* Provide design direction and governance. You utilise design to help simplify complex retail processes and problems.
* Evolve design and get hands on. You oversee the user flows, interactions, and visual design of our boutique platform.
* Be a design advocate. You liaise and co-create with your cross-functional squad, as well as other key functions in the business.
* Empower others. You are excited about educating, learning from, and collaborating with other Product Designers.
* Define the future. Trouva is an early stage startup that understands the importance of design. As such, we want a talented individual with a perspective on design.
* Own your work. You take the initiative to understand the success (or failure) of your work and are motivated to iterate and initiate change based on user feedback and metrics.
* Challenge the status quo. We believe in standing up for our ideas whilst listening to and being open to the ideas of others. You know when and how to advocate for user and business goals.
* This role reports to a Product Design Lead, whom you will work closely with to evolve Trouva’s design language and define the future of our boutique platform.

Requirements

* You’ve helped ship problem-solving products into the hands of real users. (We want to see a portfolio of work that outlines the problems you were solving, the process you applied, and the output of that process.)
* Strong visual and interaction design skills. You love creating work that is beautiful, but not at the expense of functionality.
* You can articulate your design decisions with confidence, clarity, and openness to feedback.
* You appreciate the product development process, from identifying problems and ideating solutions through to creating detailed UI design.
* Ability to create low and high-fidelity mockups. You know when to be scrappy and when to hone in on the details.

Benefits

* Competitive salary and share options in one of the UK’s most exciting startups. Equity is very important to us - we want you to be a shareholder in the company so you are part of the upside if we're successful together
* 33 days including 8 bank holidays per annum
* Company pension
* A beautiful office space in Central London, with unlimited coffee, snacks and fresh fruit
* Need tech or equipment? We'll provide whatever you need to get the job done
* Regular team events where we celebrate our success and people
* Company benefits membership (e.g. discount on Apple products, discounted gym membership, free mobile phone insurance - via Perkbox), unlimited staff discount on all Trouva products and a Trouva gift card to get something awesome for your desk

jobs.title: Talent Partner
jobs.description:
As the Trouva Talent Partner, you’ll work closely with our Founders and Senior Managers to research top talent in the market; from technology through to senior level specialist hires such as commercial and marketing. Through rigorous research, you’ll develop a thorough understanding of the market and for any role we recruit for. We don’t just sift through inbound applications; we actively seek out those who we believe to be exceptional at what they do.

Your core focus will be to build up pipelines, expand our networks and help build our employer brand; showcasing Trouva as one of the most exciting and rapidly growing tech companies in Europe.

What you’ll do:

 - Help us work from the ground up - you'll partner with the Trouva leadership to define the hiring plan and translate requirements into exciting job descriptions and interview processes

 - Proactively source for outstanding candidates; mapping the market, researching leads and sending out compelling emails

Be at the forefront of new sourcing strategies, techologies and tools, as well as driving referrals across the business

 - Seek out communities that could help us diversify our pipelines and find new opportunities for sponsoring and speaking at events

 - Have a vision for our employer brand and be able to translate that into high impact projects

 - Run a great 360 process - from the kick off meeting with the Manager, speaking with candidates and managing the offers. Your process will help us meet our targets and provide a stellar stakeholder experience

 - Track pipeline activity, ensure our ATS data is immaculate and define and hit key KPI’s which are in line with our hiring goals

Who you are:

 - Previous experience working in-house for a startup or a background in headhunting in the technology sectors

 - An outstanding communicator; your passionate about running a market leading process and obsess about providing a great candidate experience

 - Organised and methodical - your research is streamlined and all your interactions are thoroughly documented. You’ll also demonstrate a robust attention to detail and nuance - especially when it comes to liaising with and coordinating diverse sets of stakeholders.

 - Love the hunt - you get a rush of adrenaline when you find a list of coding competition winners or a well-hidden email address

 - Determined to achieve great things- you are responsive and proactive during the times that matter; this may mean unconventional working patterns, but you thrive in this kind of setting

 - Demonstrate a ‘can do’ attitude - you identify and action items regardless of area of commitment. So, whether that is scheduling, attending external round table discussions or processing contractual comments, you have it covered!

 - Have a learning mindset - you believe there are always new sourcing strategies to try, and are excited to develop your recruiting skill set

 - Warm, authentic and can build great relationships with both candidates and a variety of stakeholders
